Economic Boost: If all world debt was erased, it would lead to a significant economic boost as people would have more money to invest in businesses, education, and other areas of development. This could lead to increased job opportunities, higher wages, and overall economic growth.

Reduced Stress and Anxiety: Many people carry the burden of debt and the stress and anxiety that comes with it. If all debt was erased, people would be able to breathe a sigh of relief and focus on other aspects of their lives, such as relationships and personal growth.

Increased Consumer Spending: With no debt to pay off, people would have more disposable income to spend on goods and services. This could lead to increased consumer spending, which could in turn lead to increased economic growth.

Changes in Financial Systems: If all debt was erased, it could lead to changes in financial systems and policies. For example, governments and financial institutions may need to find new ways to manage money and invest in the economy.

Greater Access to Education and Opportunities: If all debt was erased, people would have more money to invest in education and other opportunities for personal and professional growth. This could lead to greater access to education and other opportunities, which could in turn lead to increased economic growth.
